title: Why do tall people live longer? - Quora

response.answer_text: They don’t. Men 6′2″ and above actually live 4 to 7 years shorter than short people. They are also more prone to poor health after the age of 40, like back problems, knee problems, organ failure, and cancer, because the more mass a human has, the more likely there are for problems to arise. The same is true for obese people, albeit a different set of problems. The Cost of Being Tall is a Shorter Life Expectancy Is height related to longevity?

“Why do tall people live longer?” It would be interesting if you could find any present-day data to substantiate the claim. In earlier times tallness commonly indicated better prenatal and childhood nutrition. The English aristocracy were generally rather taller than commoners, for instance but once the proletariat was better fed the differences began to disappear. Because the wealthy were better fed and cared for, and tallness was correlated with wealth, tall people tended to live longer.
